DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determined effect instrument apply spinal manipulative therapy upon dual-task performance involve complex postural cognitive task .
DOC.detailed_description: This study seek determine whether 2-week regimen spinal manipulative therapy could improve postural control 2 condition . Condition one complex postural task consist shoulder width stance compliant surface eye close remove visual input . Condition 2 addition visio-spatial cognitive task ( serial 7 subtraction ) . These task perform force-place design capture center pressure data . Data capture prior onset therapy 6 treatment session ( 2-week period ) . Data also collect 1 week post treatment note last effect follow therapy . This pilot study utilize repeated measure design control group .
DOC.criteria: Healthy participant No injury No surgeries No visual , vestibular , somatosensory disorder capable affect balance
